post.summary: Prepares an upload for an image
post.description:
If "multipart=true", returns "uploadId" that is used to fetch upload URLs for each part with
 "GET /api/v1/users/{userId}/images/{key}/{uploadId}/parts/{partNumber}". Use this URL to upload individual parts and
 get an "ETag" for each part. To finish, call "PUT /api/v1/users/{userId}/images/{key}/{uploadId}"
 with the list of all uploaded parts, containing "ETag" and "partNumber" for each part. Part numbers start at 1.

If "multipart=false", returns "presignedUrl" that is used to upload the image at once.

get.summary: Get download informations for an image

put.summary: Completes a multipart upload for an image
put.description:
Call this endpoint after uploading all parts. The body must include a list of parts "ETag" and "partNumber" in order.
 This finishes the upload and makes the image available with the provided "key".

get.summary: Get a presigned upload URL for a single part
get.description:
Call this endpoint for every part. Use the returned URL to upload the part and get an "ETag" from the HTTP headers in return.
Once all parts are uploaded, call "PUT /api/v1/users/{userId}/images/{key}/{uploadId}" with the list of all uploaded parts,
 containing "ETag" and "partNumber" for each part.

diskName.description: Must be set if attribute onlineSnapshot is false.

sources.description: Valid configurations are any IP (null or empty array), IPv4/IPv6 address (f.e. 192.168.10.1 or 0092:e10f:cb66:35a9::) or IPv4 network / IPv6 prefix (f.e. 192.168.10.0/24 or 0092:e10f:cb66:35a9::/64). If more than one IP/network is specified for the source, the destination must be empty (any) or contain only a single IP/network. If IPv4 addresses and IPv6 addresses are mixed in sources, destinations must empty (any).

sourcePorts.description: Valid configurations are any port (null), single port (f.e. 1234) or port range (f.e. 1024-65535).

destinations.description: Valid configurations are any IP (null or empty array), IPv4/IPv6 address (f.e. 192.168.10.1 or 0092:e10f:cb66:35a9::) or IPv4 network / IPv6 prefix (f.e. 192.168.10.0/24 or 0092:e10f:cb66:35a9::/64). If more than one IP/network is specified for the destination, the source must be empty (any) or contain only a single IP/network. If IPv4 addresses and IPv6 addresses are mixed in destinations, sources must be empty (any).

destinationPorts.description: Valid configurations are any port (null), single port (f.e. 1234) or port range (f.e. 1024-65535).

Authorization.description: The netcup customer number originates from the Customer Control Panel (CCP). Server Control Panel (SCP) maintains a separate user base. The CCP customer number is used as the SCP username for authentication. The SCP userId is not equal to the CCP customer number; it is a unique internal identifier assigned by SCP.
